IonAssigner - Class in tri.oxidationstates.ion
This class assigns ions to sites in a way that minimizes the global instability index
IonAssigner(Structure, OxidationStateSet) - Constructor for class tri.oxidationstates.ion.IonAssigner
Assign the given oxidation states to atom in the structure in a way that minimizes the GII.
IonAssigner(KnownIonFinder, OxidationStateSet) - Constructor for class tri.oxidationstates.ion.IonAssigner
Given an ionFinder (which identifies polyatomic ions) and a set of oxidation states, assign the oxidation states to atoms in a way that minimizes the GII.

IonFactory.IonType - Class in tri.oxidationstates.ion
This class represents an ion type, which is an atom (or cluster of atoms) that can be assigned an oxidation state.

isErrorMessage() - Method in class tri.oxidationstates.webapi.PageData
Returns an array of booleans, set to true if the corresponding messages returned by PageData.getMessages() contains an error that should be highlighted for the user, false otherwise.
isInPolyatomicIon(int) - Method in class tri.oxidationstates.ion.KnownIonFinder
Returns true if the atom at the given site is contained within a polyatomic ion, and false otherwise.
isMixedValence() - Method in class tri.oxidationstates.calculator.OxidationStateSet
Returns true if the same ion type has more than one oxidation state in this set, false otherwise.
isMixedValence() - Method in class tri.oxidationstates.webapi.TableRow
Returns true if the generated oxidation states are "mixed valence", meaning the same element (or polyatomic ion type) is associated with more than one oxidation state.
isPolyatomic() - Method in class tri.oxidationstates.ion.IonFactory.Ion
Returns true if this is a polyatomic ion (as determined by the representative structure), and false otherwise.
